close_symbols: struct MHD_Daemon (definition, fields: options, fdset_size, fdset_size_set_by_app)
explanation: To judge MISRA C 'for loop shall be well-formed' for MHD_run_from_select2 we must treat the behaviour of any for-loop body as including any functions called from that body. Although MHD_run_from_select2 contains no explicit for loops, it calls several functions (directly and indirectly) that may contain for loops or otherwise affect loop counters/loop-control flags. For each listed symbol: - struct MHD_Daemon: required to understand which fields (options, fdset_size, fdset_size_set_by_app) are read/modified in this function and in callees; these could be used as loop counters or control flags. - MHD_D_IS_USING_POLL_, MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_, MHD_D_IS_USING_EPOLL_: these macros/inline checks control code paths; their definitions may reference daemon state that could be modified elsewhere or used in loop conditions. - MHD_TEST_ALLOW_SUSPEND_RESUME: option bit tested in this function; if it aliases a variable used as loop-control elsewhere, that matters. - FD_SETSIZE, INT_MAX: constants used to compare/limit fd_setsize; if fd_setsize were used as loop counter in callees, these comparisons affect its value. - EPOLL_SUPPORT, HAVE_MESSAGES: build-time macros that enable/disable code paths (and thus inclusion of callees that may contain loops). - MHD_DLOG: logging macro/function called from this function and from many callees; its body could contain loops or modify global state used in loop guards. - MHD_epoll, MHD_cleanup_connections, resume_suspended_connections, internal_run_from_select: direct callees whose bodies must be inspected for for-loops and for any modification/usage of loop counters or loop-control flags. - new_connections_list_process_, MHD_accept_connection, call_handlers, get_timeout_millisec_int, MHD_connection_handle_idle, cleanup_upgraded_connection, MHD_pool_destroy, MHD_ip_limit_del, MHD_destroy_response, MHD_monotonic_msec_counter: transitive callees (appearing in the static call graph) called by the direct callees; their bodies may contain for loops or modify objects that a for-loop condition/counter in those functions (or in direct callees) depends on. Inspecting these symbols is necessary to determine whether any for loops that execute as part of MHD_run_from_select2's behaviour are well-formed under MISRA (single loop counter, no side effects in second clause, only loop-counter-modifying third clause, loop counter not modified in body, and that functions called within loop bodies do not indirectly modify loop counters or loop-control flags).
